results.title: Development of the big man: Lucias Mitchell
results.brief_description: Basketball coach Lucia Mitchell believes that in order to bring ou the best in the big man he must be pushed harder than other players. Mitchell stress ability and reaction drills as well as ball handling skills.

results.title: Development of speed
results.brief_description: Traces the development of style and speed in swimming through the ages. The movement of animals a bas-relief produced in 9 BC, and the crawl stroke as it has become recognized in the 20th century are studied. Details of the quick starting, racing diving, and quick turning for three well known strokes - back stroke, breast stroke, and crawl - are demonstrated.

results.title: Development of movement themes in the gymnasium (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Swift Film Productions and Margaret Rosewarne
results.brief_description: Students demonstrate the basic movements used in comparatively advanced educational gymnastics. In four parts - balance, elevation, use of apparatus, and advanced examples. Aims to encourage inventiveness and resourcefulness, and illustrates body tension, transition, and group rhythms.

results.title: Development of individual differences
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Psychology”.
Presents the thesis that though heredity sets certain limits to the development of an individual, environment, which includes everything that happens to an individual, is of great importance. Shows how Tommy and Jimmy Bradley develop different personalities since their environments are not really similar, social expectancy pushing one toward one side of the family, the other toward the other side. Reaction of the two brothers to a new neighbour and different family life are shown.

results.title: Development of feelings in children
results.creator_credit: Parents' Magazine Films and Donald Connors
results.brief_description: Describes and illustrates how the child develops feelings, stressing that the child must be allowed to express his/her feelings freely, particularly feelings of fear, anger and hate. Aims to make parents aware of the distinction between feelings and actions, and suggests ways that parents can aid the healthy emotional development of their child.
results.description: Describes and illustrates how the child develops feelings, stressing that the child must be allowed to express his/her feelings freely, particularly feelings of fear, anger and hate. Aims to make parents aware of the distinction between feelings and actions, and suggests ways that parents can aid the healthy emotional development of their child.

results.title: Development (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Bruce Hart, McGraw-Hill Films and CRM Productions
results.brief_description: This film examines the stages of growth from birth to adolescence, introducing the concept of human psychological development. Accompanied by a song written and performed by Donovan and another written by Graham Nash and performed by Crosby, stills, Nash and Young.

results.title: Development & diversity
results.creator_credit: George A. Colburn, Darrel Schwandt, GPN and DLGHS
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
Exploration of the historical, cultural, and individual diversity of childhood: what development is, how it occurs and the significance of the the prolonged period of human infancy and childhood. A visual tour of development includes children in Russia, Japan, Brazil, Cameroon and New York.
